column4: is nvidia 180 backported to intrepid? https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers-180/180.11-0ubuntu1~intrepid1, are there packages somewhere?
I don't believe it is... I just installed Ubuntu and I got 173.82 which I believe is still the latest non beta nvidia driver
what is this then https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers-180/180.11-0ubuntu1~intrepid1 ?
I haven't seen that but would recommend you check the nvidia website to see what the latest non-beta driver is.  Also I wouldn't worry much about updating unless you're having issues
yes i am aware of it, that it is beta, but there are problems with title bars on nvidia card geforce 7,6 series (with compiz compositing manager)
You'll probably have to do a manual install then per the instructions on the Nvidia site.  I do remember seeing them there but haven't tried it myself
i do not really want to install it with every kernel update
I sure understand that... but I doubt it's going to be included in the released version of Ubuntu as long as it's beta
i hope it will be included somewhere as packages :-)
yeah I was looking for it myself the other day just to try it out.  I didn't see it though
I even checked out some other distros and they're all using 173.82 as well
177.82 I mean
sorry
why have you checked that? do you have issues?
I run Wine and some windows apps... was curious to see if there was any performance difference
i only have found https://launchpad.net/~thomas-creutz/+archive for intrepid
it seems to have positive replies https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nvidia-graphics-drivers-177/+bug/297543
reading that
at the ending
wow there's a lot of comments out there concerning that driver
Looks like it's only going to be released with Jaunty though
If you have a spare machine to play with, you might want to download the jaunty beta just to see how it works
it is too boring at the moment :-)
